name: User is able to configure and trigger periodic builds as scheduled.
description: A User can enable the "Build periodically trigger" in a Freestyle project and that the build runs according to the specified schedule.
descriptionHtml: A User can enable the "Build periodically trigger" in a Freestyle project and that the build runs according to the specified schedule.
statusMessage: XPASS May fail due to non-reproducible concurrent builds locally.

beforeStages.name: Navigate to the New Item Page.

steps.name: Go to the New Item Page by clicking New Item button.
Navigate to "NewItemPage"
Create new freestyle project with the name "'New Freestyle Project'".
Input project name "New Freestyle Project".
Select "Freestyle project" type.
Click "OK" button.
Go to the Freestyle Project Configuration page.

beforeStages.name: Configure Freestyle project with cron schedule and wait for periodic build to complete.

steps.name: Enable 'Build periodically' and set cron schedule"'*/1 * * * *'".
Check "Build periodically" checkbox.
Enter cron schedule '*/1 * * * *' into the Schedule field
Save configurations.
Click Save Button and go to the Freestyle Project Page.
Wait up to 60 seconds for the build to appear in the build history.
Wait for 'Builds' link to be visible
Go to the main page by clicking logo.
Navigate to "MainPage"

testStage.description: A User can enable the "Build periodically trigger" in a Freestyle project and that the build runs according to the specified schedule.
testStage.statusMessage: XPASS May fail due to non-reproducible concurrent builds locally.

steps.name: Go to the Build History page by clicking Build History button.
Get existing builds list.
Assert that only one build is displayed in the list.
Assert that the project name of the displayed build is "New Freestyle Project".
Assert that the build has number "#1".

afterStages.name: Configure WebDriver with options and save failure screenshot.::0

labels.name: tag
labels.value: @pytest.mark.xfail(reason='May fail due to non-reproducible concurrent builds locally.')
